forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Drizzle after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 47, with temperatures rising to around 49 overnight. South southwest wind 5 to 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Drizzle before 10am, then rain. Cloudy. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 9 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, a soft drizzle whispers through the streets, cloaking the city in a veil of moisture. The atmosphere is thick with clouds that weave a tapestry of grey across the skyline, hinting at the showers which will soon become a steadfast rain. The temperature, hovering around the cool edge of the night, brings a crispness that beckons for a warm jacket. The air is imbued with the scent of impending rain, creating a serene yet slightly somber ambiance, perhaps nudging one towards the comfort of a cozy café or a quiet spot to read.

Tomorrow promises to greet us with a relentless downpour, the kind that makes one want to curl up with a steaming cup of tea. Expect the high to be just on the cooler side, accentuated by gusty winds that may rustle fallen leaves along the pavement. As the marine layer tucks in around the hills, visibility may be muted, lending a hushed quality to the city's usual vibrancy. A stroll through the neighborhoods might not be the most inviting of pursuits, yet a visit to the local bookstores or art galleries could offer a reprieve from the wet weather, inviting the mind to wander while the rain harmonizes with the soothing clatter of an umbrella against the cobblestones.
